Dear Ms. Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth threw a rock at a window at which point staff stepped in to
intervene. Youth began arguing with staff and hit staff. Staff
proceeded to do a routine Physical Crisis Intervention (PCI) for
restraining purposes. Staff became rougher than needed and
pulled youth’s arm back too far and roughly. Staff was also
antagonizing youth to attack staff. While youth was swinging to
punch staff, staff was holding out hand to block youth's hits. Staff
made a sudden movement and hit youth in the neck that appeared
to be intentional. This knocked the wind out of youth. Youth
struggled to breathe properly for a while and was wheezing. Other
staff attempted to deescalate the situation, and this upset staff.
Staff began yelling at the other staff that they are babying youth.
As things began winding down staff kicked youth in the stomach.
Youth was seen to have a red mark on the stomach the size of a
2

quarter, youth’s neck was also observed to be pink in color from
being hit. Youth was not sent for medical attention. Youth’s lower
stomach, upper chest, and neck were sore. Some swelling was
noted in youth’s lower stomach. Youth was checked on and
seemed to be breathing fine as the evening went on.
Investigation A complaint was received on 7/17/23 alleging that Staff 1, who is
upper management at the facility, stepped in to assist staff with
Youth A who was upset because she could not go to the store.
Youth A threw a rock at a window. Staff 1 and Youth A began
arguing with each other. Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A but
was rougher than he needed to be. Staff 1 ended up pulling Youth
A's arm back too far. Staff 1 was also antagonizing Youth A to
attack him. Youth A tried to hit Staff 1, so Staff 1 was holding out
his hand to block her hits. Staff 1 made a sudden movement and
hit Youth A in the neck. Youth A then struggled to breath. Other
staff tried to deescalate the situation, and this upset Staff 1. Staff 1
kicked Youth A in the stomach.
Interviews
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/18/23. He
reported he is the quality and compliance manager for the agency.
He reviewed the incident and found that it started when Youth A
wanted to go to the Humane Society and was not allowed. He
stated the incident occurred outside. Staff 1 is the placement
coordinator for the agency and was filling in as direct care staff
because they were short on staff. Staff 1 is currently on medical
leave due to being injured during the incident with Youth A. Staff 5
had access to the video and was able to show it on his computer.
Staff 5 reported Staff 2 was with Youth A in the road then is joined
by Staff 1. Staff 3 was also working but was in the house at the
time. Staff 3 is the clinical director who was also filling in as direct
care staff.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 7/18/23. She did not have any additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/18/23
along with the DHHS Worker and local Law Enforcement. Youth A
stated she needed a break as her peer was frustrating her, so she
left out of her bedroom window as she was told could not take a
break. Staff 2 followed her out and they sat by the fire hydrant.
She was upset but not with Staff 2. Staff 1 upsets her because he
had previously visited her before she was placed at the facility and
following the visit she was placed at the facility. Staff 1 came out
and Youth A said she took a gutter and either Staff 1 or Staff 2
took it out of her hand. She tried to hit Staff 1, so they restrained
3

her. She fell to the ground and Staff 1 and Staff 2 pulled her back
up by her arms while she was on her stomach. Youth A said she
was able to get out of the restraint. Staff 1 sat on the “green thing”
outside and told her to come at him. Youth A tried to go after him,
and he kicked her. Youth A said she was crying, and Staff 1 kept
instigating her telling her to come at him. She said Staff 1 wanted
her to go at him so he could fight her. Staff 3 was standing in the
doorway to the house and Staff 2 watched the incident with Staff 1
happen. Youth A reported no one did anything. Youth A reported
Staff 1 had told one of the youth "I dare you to bite me." She did
not know which youth it was and she did not know when this
occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at a local park on 7/25/23
along with the DHHS Worker. He stated on the day of the incident
he was watching the youth in the pool when Staff 3 asked if he
could assist Staff 2. He reported Staff 3 is a therapist so she could
not do anything. Staff 1 said when Youth A went to hit him, he put
his hand out to block the hit and may have accidentally made
contact with Youth A with his hand. He reported he told Youth A to
go ahead and see where it gets her. He stated Youth A tried to
kick him so he would lift his leg to block her kicks, but he never
kicked Youth A. He reported he and Staff 2 were not on the same
page. Staff 2 called for the restraint. Youth A was throwing mulch
in his face. Once they put Youth A into a restraint she fell to the
ground, and he tried to lift her up. He stated Youth A was not all
the way down on the ground at the time. Staff 1 stated he did not
know staff could not lift youth back up. Staff 1 said Youth A was
upset that morning because Staff 2 was making promises he
could not keep. He stated Staff 2 does not provide structure and is
inconsistent. Staff 1 reported he gets trained in CPI every year.
A conversation occurred with the Licensee Designee (LD) face to
face at the facility on 7/25/23. She stated Staff 1 would not be
filling in at the facility anymore. She believed Staff 2 did not
respond quick enough. She stated clinical staff can intervene if
there is an emergency otherwise, they are told they should not
restrain.
Staff 2/Complainant was interviewed by phone on 8/17/23. Staff 2
stated Youth A was having a rough day and had climbed out her
window then walked around outside. Staff 2 followed Youth A and
tried to calm her down. Youth A was picking up and throwing
rocks at the house. Some of the rocks Staff 2 was able to block.
Staff 2 is familiar with Youth A and she will usually calm down but
she does not like Staff 1 so when he came out to assist she yelled
4

and cussed at him. Youth A had a downspout she was swinging
around so Staff 1 took it from her. Youth A then went to hit Staff 1
so they placed her in a restraint. Staff 2 said Youth A ended up on
the ground, so they let go of her. Youth A got back up and Staff 1
tried to put her back in a restraint, but he was pulling on Youth A’s
arm real hard. Staff 2 tried to help. Youth A was still trying to fight
and Staff 1 put his hand out quick and knocked the wind out of
Youth A who stated she could not breath and dropped to the
ground. Staff 2 said the alleged hit was a quick movement by
Staff 1 to Youth A’s chest. When Youth A went to stand up again,
she said Staff 1 had kicked her. Staff 2 could not see what Staff 1
did because he was standing with his back to Staff 2 trying to
separate Youth A from Staff 1. After the incident Staff 2 asked
Staff 1 about the alleged hit and Staff 1 responded that he put his
hand out and Youth A ran into it. Staff 2 reported he had heard of
such a move from another youth. This youth came from another
facility that Staff 1 worked at. The youth told Staff 2 that he was
taught this move by the staff at the facility. The youth said it was a
move that would not be seen as a hit but actually was a hit. Staff 2
thought maybe this was something the other facilities may have
used.
Video
Youth A and Staff 2 are outside in the driveway. Youth A tries to
walk away from Staff 2 but Staff 2 stays with her. Youth A picks
something up and throws it at the house. Staff 2 tried to block her.
Youth A then walks to the end of the house and is out of sight of
the camera. When she returns, she has a downspout in her hand.
Staff 2 is still with her. Staff 1 walks behind them, then runs up to
Youth A and grabs the downspout from her hand. Youth A tries to
hit Staff 1. Staff 1 and Staff 2 put Youth A in a standing restraint.
Youth A drops to her knees and Staff 1 pulls on Youth A’s arms to
get her back up. Youth A then falls to her stomach. The staff
continue to pull on Youth A’s arms. Staff 1 let’s go and moves
away from Youth A. Staff 1 suddenly grabs Youth A’s arm while
she is still sitting on the ground. Youth A gets up and approaches
Staff 1. Staff 1 tries to block Youth A’s hits while Staff 2 is there
but does not physically engage Youth A. Staff 1 puts one of Youth
A’s arms in a restraint hold but Staff 2 does not assist him. Youth
A is able to get free. Staff 1 appears upset as he waves his hands
in the air and takes his shirt off. Youth A continues to hit Staff 1.
Staff 1 pushes Youth A away a few times and then grabs Youth
A’s arm and pushes her head down. Youth A gets free, and Staff 1
sits on a large electrical type box. Youth A approaches Staff 1 and
Staff 1 kicks his foot out kicking Youth A. She drops to the ground.
Youth A then goes inside with Staff 2.
5

Documents Reviewed
• Staff 1 Employee file: Staff 1 has been working for the
agency since 1996. He was trained in CPI on 2/15/23 and
behavior interventions on 6/21/23. He did not have any
disciplines.
• Staff 2 Employee file: Staff 2 was hired on 4/11/23. He
received training on self-help tools during tirades on
5/10/23, Behavior interventions on 6/14/23, and CPI on
4/12/23. He was disciplined for failing to use agency taught
CPI on 5/27/23 and a medication error on 7/2/23.
• Restraint policy: The facility utilizes the Crisis Prevention
Institute's (CPI), Non-Violent Physical Crisis Intervention
when using physical restraint interventions. All physical
restraint interventions are performed by two staff members.
No individual staff member will perform a restraint by
themselves.
Analysis Staff 1 is seen on video pushing, pulling, and kicking Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000544 dated 7/18/23, CAP is pending
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During a restraint staff became rougher than needed and pulled
youth’s arm back too far and roughly.
Investigation Interviews
During Youth A’s interview she indicated the staff pulled her arms
after dropping to the ground during a restraint. She also reported
Staff 2 did not do anything to help while Staff 1 was dealing with
her.
Staff 1 admitted in his interview that he did not know he was not
supposed to pull Youth A’s arms in order to get her off the ground.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was not on the same page as him and
because of this he was not helping when Youth A continuously
tried to hit Staff 1.
6

Staff 2 reported Staff 1 did pull on Youth A’s arms “real hard” in
order to get her into a restraint. He also stated after they put Youth
A into a standing hold then when he looked down, he saw she
was on the ground and they let her go.
Video
Youth A is seen on video on her knees while Staff 1 and Staff 2
pull her arms from behind her. Youth A then lays on her stomach
and still staff try to pull her arms from behind. After the initial
restraint Staff 1 tried to restrain Youth A 2 more times but Staff 2
did not assist with the hold so they were not maintained.
Documents Reviewed
• CPI training materials: CPI does not have a restraint
technique in which staff pull the youths arms while the
youth is on the ground.
• Restraint Policy: All restraints are performed by two staff
members. No staff member will perform a restraint by
themselves.
Analysis Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen on video holding onto Youth A's arms
while she is on the ground. They pull on her arms in order to get
her up off the ground.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000228 dated 3/23/23; CAP approved on 4/18/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal History check, subject to
Section requirement; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member does not have the ability to perform his duties.
Investigation During the DHHS Pre-dispositional conference the DHHS Worker
stated Staff 1 would be confirmed for improper supervision.
Analysis Staff 1 was confirmed for improper supervision.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000228 dated 3/23/23, CAP approved on 4/18/23
SIR 2023C0000544 dated 7/18/23, CAP is pending
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior management.
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall include
Description all of the following:
7

(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management, and
social skills.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 instigated Youth A during a behavior episode.
Investigation Interviews
During Youth A’s interview she stated Staff 1 was instigating her
and encouraging her to fight him. This made her more upset.
During Staff 1’s interview he admitted he was upset during the
incident with Youth A and that he told Youth A to try and hurt him.
During Staff 2’s interview he stated Staff 1 was saying Staff 2
baby’s the youth and he was verbally provoking Youth A. Staff 2
reported when he first started at the facility it was common for the
staff to provoke the youth like Staff 1 did.
Documents reviewed
• DHHS Worker Social Work Contacts: Staff 2 interview
notes. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 was telling Youth A to go
ahead and hit him which was making the situation worse.
He also reported Staff 1 told Staff 2 he was bating Youth A.
• The facilities behavior management policy was reviewed.
The policy indicated different techniques staff can utilize to
help defuse a crisis situation. None of those techniques
were utilized by Staff 1.
Analysis Staff 1 did not intervene positively when he verbally instigated
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
